context: [3] However, these were measured in summer 1998 . [4] The PROPHET 1998 campaign was conducted at the same tower and during a roughly similar period: 11 July to 20 August. [5] The average meteorological conditionsâ€”temperature, wind direction, wind speed, and humidityâ€” were nearly identical for that time period in the two years. [6] Furthermore, the mean atmospheric concentrations, diurnal variations, and temperature dependences for CO, NO, NO2, O3, OH, HO2, isoprene, benzene, and toluene were the same to within 1 SD for both years. [7] By assuming that the atmospheric composition at the PROPHET site was the same for both summers, we can combine the data sets to provide complete coverage of the known and previously measured atmospheric constituents in a forest (Table 1). [1] VOCs and other chemical species measured and used in the OH reactivity calculation. [2] If not otherwise indicated, the species were measured in 2000 with the OH reactivity.
